comment: Passionate about philosophy. Top tier humor. Gives tedious assignments. She does it to help you understand the material better which is helpful, but fails to consider how time consuming these assignments are for undergrad. Her teaching method is perhaps a bit too inclusive for everyone's perspective, but the care for her students is undeniable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: I took Dr.M as much as I could. She is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable about each philosophy course, and is always eager to help everyone understand intense concepts in digestible manners. By far my favorite professor! Her grading is very fair, as long as you attempt the essays and convey a brief grasp of understanding.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. M is the most engaging professor I've ever had. Her classes are very reading-heavy, but she makes it very easy to connect with. Very obvious that she cares about what she teaches and wants you to care too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: I regret taking her this semester. Her weekly assignments are super long and tedious, as though we don't have other classes...expect up to 70 pages of reading per week, and thats not including the quiz or the lengthy assignments. It's a lot for a intro course, maybe I'm just not as passionate about philosophy but this class is makes me hate it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: First week we had a document with 50 pages of reading, and maybe 30 questions to answer. It doesn't seem crazy but she makes you explain your answers in 2-3 sentences so it ended up being pages long. You can't even access your quiz/lecture videos for the week unless you submit the assignment first. Do not take if you have a lot of hard classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Quizzes were easy if you watched her video and read at least some of the text she assigned. However, there is a lot of reading assigned with this course so be ready for that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best professor at KSU hands down. Be prepared to read 30-60 pages a class period, which is expected for any upper-level philosophy course. Classes are discussion-based rather than lecture-intensive. Dr. M genuinely wants to see you succeed and provides great feedback. Her grading method is forgiving and clear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Dr. Mirzakhan for my summer philosophy class, thought it would be boring but the selected materials by Dr. Mirzakhan proved me wrong. Content was interesting but get ready to read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Engaging, fair grading criteria, learned lots. I wouldn't say it's an easy A but it is a reasonable amount of work. Most of the class is discussing assigned readings and taking open notes quizzes. You'll enjoy this class. Take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: the goat, as always
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Other reviews say that the workload was extremely heavy, but I would just say that it's tedious. It is not overwhelming, you just actually have to put in effort. Her lecture videos open after you submit an assignment and the are never longer than 20 minutes. She is clearly passionate about philosophy and I appreciate the way she teaches it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Great discussion promoted in class, can make any topic digestible and interesting. You do have to put in the effort, do the readings, and ask questions. Not the kind of class you can just look up answers for on Quizlet. Incredibly interesting and rewarding for students who try.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: short writing assignment over the tectbook every week, a quiz every week web came and lockdown, have to submit the SWA in order to unlock her videos I just think she was doing too much
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: By far the best professor I've ever had. Actually cares about her students and has a true passion for philosophy. Taking her class changed me as a person for the better and I ended up taking every class she taught before I ended up dropping out lol.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational--Caring

comment: Took this class bc I saw the professor had good reviews but after taking the class I'm confused why. Professor provides an EXTREMELY heavy workload but the work given was extremely tedious & unnecessarily difficult for an intro course. Took so long to actually grade the insane amount of work she gave. Quizzes provide no actual  substance either
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Mirzakhan was a great teacher! Attendance and participation is required. There were quizzes or short writing assignments due every class, but she lets you bring notes for quizzes. There were a lot of readings! As long as you participate in the class and do your work, you should be fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I love this professor! Classes schedule is loaded on to d2l at beginning of semester, so it is easy to prepare for each class. Quiz or swa due every class, but they are simple and easy to do. Attendance is mandatory, but it is honestly not that bad. Discussions are fun and intriguing, especially near end of semester. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: She gives work over spring break and makes it due on the regular time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Love her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: discussions are open-ended, quizzes and writing assignments are SUPER easy, but there's a lot of reading, daily work, and a tough final/midterm. definitely a specific grader, but you'll make an A if you put in the effort, show up to class, and actively communicate. im minoring in phil just bc of her class and taking her next semester. take her!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Don't take this class if you get sick or don't feel like you can make it every class. Expect a quiz every class & don't be late by even 5min--you could miss the entire quiz bc it is oral and she won't repeat the Qs. Not allowed to make up work for any reason. Lectures are discussion that isn't centered on teaching philosophy of the hard readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice, funny, chill, relatable, and clearly intelligent. Strict policies regarding attendance and assignments but overall one of the best professors I have had. Class is more discussion based and very interesting material to study. A lot of reading, writing and quizzes but discussions make it a lot easier to understand and participate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: I loved this class and this professor but it is not an easy A. Lots of weekly quizzes and short writing assignments that require lockdown browser. You read a lot of material throughout the class so make sure you are taking notes EVERY week or you wont be prepared for the final which is cumulative. She is accessible outside of class and caring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Best professer at KSU. I hate KSU but she and her class has been the only one I have enjoyed and felt like I have learned from. She is super informative and funny and makes the class really engaging. I came into the class scared because I am not very good a reading and analyzing texts and she helped me gain better skills in them so much. Take her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Hilarious

comment: The only reason I'm not giving her a perfect score is because she only accepts work being turned in on paper, by hand (with a few exceptions). This wasn't too compatible with my workflow. That said, her class is built on discussion, and Dr. M clearly shows a passion for the material and the discussion of said material. I'd recommend her to anyone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: She's quite amiable and a great teacher that clearly cares about and knows her subject. If you engage with the texts and participate in class you shouldn't have any issues. Some say that she gives a lot of work but it's just a few assignments a week and some readings. 100% take her in person though, her class is formatted to be discussion-based.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Beware she gives a heavy workload in the first few weeks. However by the end of the semester there is a lot less work. As long as you watch her lectures you will pass. I did not fail a single test in this class. She will let you send her projects ahead of time to receive feedback before you submit. Just do your best and you will pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: This class is easy, but the amount of work/homework you have to do is astronomical. This is the last gen ed I am taking and I am putting more time and work into this class than I did in BOTH anatomy classes. WAY too much work for a gen ed. She is nice and everything, but eh. Lockdown for every quiz, and like 10 assignments due every Wednesday.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Its all busy work with tests and quizzes that have very little relation to the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: she was a nice lady but her class seemed so unorganized, she was always behind on grading and would expect us to know a lot and not really teach us in class if she felt we didn't do our reading
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Definitely one of my favorite professors I have ever taken. She is hilarious and the reading is required, participation is encouraged!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Class is a lot of work but Dr. M is fair and willing to help. Great professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: professor M is hilarious and she makes the class a lot of fun. she assigns reading hw every class and sometimes does quizzes but the main grading is participation. you have to always participate in her class discussion or you may not pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Her online class was a lot of reading. Every week she would have us read a passage and either take a quiz on it or do a short writing assignment. You can make a good grade in there if you just do the work and listen to the lectures. Her attendance for the online class was just a discussion post every week. Overall a good class, but it is not easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. M is a wonderful professor and is willing to help, but the exam time frame is extremely short for multiple essay-based questions. Be prepared to read a lot and annotate very well. If you don't read or annotate the weekly text you will not do well in the course. Also, she gives extra credit which helps. I would take a different course for gen ed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Definitely someone who should be a philosophy teacher. Very entertaining class. Essay tests which are not too difficult, but a bit of a pain. A bit of difficult reading. She doesn't just cover old white european guys so that's nice.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--Get ready to read

comment: Professor M is amazing. I have throughly enjoyed sitting in her class and listening to her teach and talk about the criteria. There are reading assignments literally every night for homework, but as long as you read through the entire thing and understand it, the quizzes are a breeze. I highly recommend taking Professor M, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Mirzakhan introduces western philosophy in this class, her main issue is her lack of life experience so she teaches this material with no wisdom to reflect it upon. She focuses mostly on feministic views, so be ready for half her material to be about feminism. You also jump around the material a lot so it feels like theres no real course objective.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I've taken Dr. M twice now and she's by far my favorite teacher. Attendance and participation end up being a large part of your grade, so make sure you go. Lots of essays, but she gives good feedback & helps you outside of class if you ask. A normal lecture is an overview of the reading and then an open discussion. 100% recommend taking her
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is an amazing professor! She is always open to complicated questions and wants everyone to participate. There is a lot of reading (every class session for next class) but all 3 exams are the same setup, just different readings. Last exam is the final and drops lowest 2 quiz scores. Take her if you can! You just have to stay on top of your work!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dont get me wrong, its a hard class, but with Professor M, i wouldnt hesitate to take it again, the constant homework got annoying but its understandable with the content. She was definitely one of my favorite professors though. All exams are the same set up, including the final, so youll know what to expect. Just show up and pay attention.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. M is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is absolutely hilarious, and she explains the unintelligible content in a simple way that makes sense. She's always willing to help, and encourages questions. However, the homework assignments average around five to ten pages, and you MUST read them before next class or you won't get credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Professor M is very passionate about her class, however it is almost impossible to get a good grade in this class. It is extremely difficult. For every class there will be a writing assignment or a 4 or 5 question quiz. Her tests are also impossible and are graded very tough.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Mirzakhan is hilarious. Passionate about philosophy, class is always fun since she's so goofy and the whole class gets all fired up about philosophy. Lots of reading and assignments but it's never difficult, just pay attention in class since her handwriting is intelligible and do all readings, could be pop quizzes. Best class ever.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious--Amazing lectures
